snippet.title: Cootamundra MP Katrina Hodgkinson has announced her shock resignation
snippet.content:
Cootamundra MP Katrina Hodgkinson resigns
Katrina Hodgkinson
Katrina at the Henty Machinery Field Days in 2012.
Katrina Hodgkinson
Katrina speaks at a water forum in Wagga in 2012.
Katrina with Junee's Pam Halliburton while she was the National's candidate during the 2015 state election.
Katrina with member for Riverina Michael McCormack, Dr Lan Snell of CSU and NSW small business commissioner Yasmin King in 2011.
Katrina inspects an apple orchid damaged by hail in Batlow in 2011.
Agri Australis Pty Limited general manger Alessandro Boccardo and Katrina in 2014 planting hazelnut trees on the outskirts of Narrandera.
Katrina at the $1 million Plant Growth Facility at the National Wine and Grape Industry Centre with director Jim Hardy in 2011.
Katrina inspects an apple orchid damaged by hail in Batlow in 2011.
Katrina visits the Inland Fisheries Centre at Narrandera in 2014.
Member for Burrinjuck Katrina at the opening of the Gundagai multipurpose service in 2013.
Katrina with the manager of Inland Fisheries Centre, Les Rava, at Narrandera in 2014.
Katrina in Tumut during the election in 2003.
Katrina at the Murray-Darling Basin Plan rally in Griffith in 2012.
Katrina, as the member for Burrinjuck, with then parliamentary secretary for regional health, Melinda Pavey MLC, in 2013.
Katrina as the member for Burrinjuck at the 75th birthday of the Dog on the Tuckerbox in 2007.
Katrina at the Murray-Darling Basin Plan rally in Griffith in 2012.
Katrina with Gundagai residents and Andrew Stoner in 2006.
Katrina, as the member for Burrinjuck, farewelled the people of Tumut as her electorate changed and Tumut was given to member for Wagga Daryl Maguire. in 2007.
Katrina makes an announcement in 2015 as Minister for Primary Industries.
Katrina and member for Wagga Daryl Maguire at the announcement of $70 million for Gocup Road in 2015.
Katrina at the Murray-Darling Basin Plan rally in Griffith in 2012.
Katrina at the Henty Machinery Field Days in 2011.
Katrina, as member for Burrinjuck, at the Cootamundra Aboriginal Girls' Home centenary in 2012.
Katrina opens the $1 million Plant Growth Facility at the National Wine and Grape Industry Centre in 2011.
Katrina with Gundagai mayor Len Tozer, member for Riverina Kay Hull and RTA CEO Michael Bushby at the opening of Hume Highway new dual carriageway bypassing Jugiong in 2009.
exit COOTAMUNDRA MP Katrina Hodgkinson has announced her shock resignation, forcing the electorate into a by-election.
Issuing a statement at 4pm on Monday, Ms Hodgkinson said it had been an honour to serve the Riverina.
While details remain scarce, she said her decision was not one based on a single issue - rather her "length of service". The Nationals parliamentarian thanked her husband Jack for his support throughout nearly two decades of public life - and her wonderful children, Georgia and Hamilton, who have known her as an "MP Mum".
This makes her the fourth party member to announce their exit from parliament this year, following Duncan Gay, and Thomas George and Kevin Humphries who will retire at the 2019 election.
MORE TO COME
